message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS 

This paper is likely to belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category as it deals with hyper-parameter tuning for three well-known baselines. It also involves performing an extensive 10-Folds Cross-Validation on two datasets, which is a common practice in machine learning research. 

It could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the paper evaluates the performance of different hyper-parameter combinations in terms of accuracy and novelty, which are important metrics in information retrieval. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as hyper-parameter tuning is a crucial aspect of building intelligent systems. 

The paper also involves evaluating the discriminative power of different metrics, which could place it under cs.CV (Computer Vision) as metrics are commonly used to evaluate the performance of computer vision models. 

Finally, it could belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as the paper involves a grid search strategy to explore the hyper-parameter space, which is a common technique in algorithm design and optimization.
